answers.answer: My doc checks mine at every apt....Swelling is a warning sign.  Perhaps you need a new doc.I would go to a pharmacy and have it checked.  I routinely check mine whenever I can.

Yeah, your doctor should definitely be checking your BP. wtf... thats crazy that he's not. You should start checking it if he's not. I don't know what's around you, but a lot of drug stores sometimes have BP machines where u can check it. The induced my sis in law cause her BP got too high. Especially since you are swollen. Those are key signs of pre eclamsia.

demand your blood pressure to be taken or get a new dr.  i dont know if you can change this late, maybe he is with a group. but its insane they dont monitor you.  yes pre eclampia is something not to be taken lightly. i have never been to a dr and them not take my bp.  drink lots of water, eat watermelon, but most importantly have your bp taken just to make sure its not too high. medical care might be needed if it rises too high!
Thats strange that he doesnt check it. I never heard of that before. Whenever I go, they check BP and urine (for protein i guess). I would get a new doctor.

Seriously...I've never heard of this before. Your BP is VERY important, especially in the third trimester. What kind of doctor doesn't check BP at EVERY visit?? The nurses get my weight and blood pressure at every visit before the doctor comes in. I would be questioning their practice!!

well....i would say they've checked it 2 or 3 times total since i've been prego.  they 99% of the time have me pee in a cup before my appt...so maybe they do this instead?  is that even possible?  regardless...i am going to ask them to check it on tuesday...and ask them what it is...and ask them a whole bunch of other questions i've been having lately!!! thanks ladies!
That's odd.  I get mine checked at every appt.  You should ask about that.

My doctor's nurse always took my BP with my son... Your doctor can never be too careful. A month before my delivery, my blood pressure sky rocketed. So they had to send me to the hospital that same day. My son was born in only 7 hours but then I bleed a lot and it would not stop. I passed out and the next day when I woke up the doctor told me I needed a blood transfusion. It took me a long time to recover from it and it also sunk me into PPD. Your story may not be the same as mine... but I would take caution.

my dr always checks my bp. today it was a bit high, so they had me lay on my left side and then it was fine. he wasn't worried though. they said as long as it goes down when i lay on my left side, then it's OK. plus, my urine specimen was OK. sitting i was 140/83... laying down it dropped to 118.as for the swelling, mine is a lot like what you describe (we should get together and compare!!). i even get it pooling at the base of my toes and it looks like i have blisters. my fingers are very swollen and sore. he said in this heat, it is normal and to make sure i stay hydrated.but to answer your question... i think they should be checking your bp, as it can be an indicator of other problems. and i'm curious to know who your dr is... email me and let me know.
I have to pee in a cup and get my BP taken at every visit. I dont know why they are not doing this especially since you are swelling. I would ask next time or request a new dr.

i'm 18 weeks and my doctor doesn't take mine either. he is very laid back, i think because he is confident with his 25 years of experience. i would be much more comfortable with an extra cautious doctor, although my doc is very nice. let me know what the response is if you ask.

I am 31w and my doctor checks mine everytime I go.  That's the first thing they do.  I have a lot of swelling and my blood pressure was up last week and I was told to lay off the salt and limit my activities.  If the bottom number got over 100 I had to go to the emergancy room.  Lucky I'm off for two weeks for vacation to rest but if it doesn't go down I'll be on bed rest the rest of the time.  Maybe you need to go to the store and check yourself or you could go to the fire station and see if they can check it.  Your blood pressure is nothing to play with while your pregnant.  Take care of yourself and baby.  To ease your mind go somewhere and get it checked.  Take care

I would ask them why they are not.  When I was preg with my dd my ankles and feet got SO swollen and tight and my bloodpressure (which is usually on the low side) shot up really high so much so they ended up sending me to the hospital after a few of my appointments.  I think that's odd that they don't check it on a regular basis.  Were your ankles very swollen at your last visit and they still didn't check it?  Good luck!  :)

It is up to the dr's discretion whether or not to check th bp. It is however a good idea, but some dr's trust that most bp problems start later on in pregnancy. They also know your history and family history. My guess is that his routine will have your bp checked around 30 weeks or so.Also, they do count on the urine showing protein, etc. It can also be used for longer term checking than the bp check which is just the measuring of it at that moment.Some dr's will do blood work when trying to rule out PIH versus a fluke high bp reading. And in all reality, most women's bp goes up by just walking into the dr's office, then goes down upon exiting.Swelling in hands and feet are normal in pregnancy. Make sure to cut down on sodium-carbonated drinks, processed foods and fast foods. Elevate your feet as much as you can. The baby is growing and presses against the aorta (large blood vessel). This causes the blood to pool and swelling to occur.If you notice swelling that is going up the shin/knee area that doesn't go away with elevation, or sudden severe headaches, you should have your bp checked.Sorry this is so lengthy, best wishes to you and your pregnancy!

thank you all for your advice...i actually feel a lot better about my situation.  i am going to definitely ask on tuesday!!! for now i am limiting salt, increasing water intake, and keeping my feet up (as much as i can while sitting at my desk!)

question: Hey all...another questions from me...I've had a ton lately!!!  My ankles have been super swollen the past week or so...and the last 3 days or so my feet have been too.  They are so swollen that my flip flops are tight - and the skin actually hurts and feel like it is going to pop!  I called my doctor today to ask if there is anything i can do and they told me to drink water and stop eating salty food.  I'm just a little nervous cause a friend of mine had preeclampsia around 30 weeks and ended up delivering early.  my doctor never even checks my BP...is this normal??  I feel like everyone else says they get checked every appt.  My doctor just weighs me, uses the doppler and sends me on my way - 15 minute appt tops.  Am I missing something?
title: 29 weeks...Dr. NEVER checks my BP ~ is this okay?
